title: Chief Data Officer
description:
Do you love to build, innovate, create and collaborate? Come grow your career and make an impact with PrimePay - a growth focused, flexible and established Human Capital Management (HCM) SaaS technology company.


As we continue our evolution and growth into a leading HCM SaaS technology provider to businesses, we are seeking our next Chief Data Officer. The Chief Data Officer (CDO) assumes a pivotal role within the organization, tasked with creating and overseeing the implementation of a comprehensive data strategy aligned with the organization's objectives. This entails developing and managing data architecture, systems and processes to facilitate efficient data acquisitions, storage, integration and management. A key responsibility involves ensuring compliance with data governance standards and regulatory requirements, safeguarding the accuracy, reliability and security of organizational data assets. Additionally, the CDO plays a crucial role in evaluating technologies to enhance data capabilities and operational efficiencies. Through effective leadership and strategic planning, the CDO drives the organization towards becoming more data-driven, facilitating informed decision-making and fostering innovation.



At PrimePay, we are seeking those excited to build, create, and innovate. We are problem-solvers who move quickly, collaborate with agility and differentiate through people, purpose and commitment. With a 30+ year history, we are writing the next chapter of our journey with a focus on great technology, a People First Culture and a commitment to personal and professional growth. At PrimePay, our extraordinary people create our future every single day. Interested? Join us in our evolution!


Responsibilities:


* Develop and implement a comprehensive data strategy to meet current and future organizational needs.
* Design and manage data architecture, systems, and roadmap for data acquisition, storage, integration, and management
* Utilize data warehouses, stores, and business intelligence systems to efficiently manage and distribute data
* Establish data governance standards and policies to ensure data accuracy, reliability, and security
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and implement measures to protect sensitive data
* Evaluate emerging technologies to enhance data capabilities and operational efficiency


Qualifications:


* Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree in a related field preferred
* 5+ years’ experience in data management and leadership roles
* Experience in managing business units or corporate functions with major organizational impact
* Proven experience in data management and operations, demonstrating a track record of successfully designing and implementing data strategies
* Strong understanding of the data governance principles and regulatory compliance, ensuring adherence to industry standards and regulations
* Knowledge of emerging technologies in data management and analysis, with the ability to evaluate and integrate innovative solutions
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, capable of effectively leading teams and conveying complex technical concepts to stakeholders
* Business acumen and strategic thinking, enabling the alignment of data initiatives with overarching organizational goals
* Demonstrated ability to lead and manage teams, fostering a collaborative and results-oriented work environment


**PrimePay Offers:**


* A competitive salary in the $200K - $250K range based on experience
* Access to personal, group training and career advancement
* Leadership development through individualized support and career mentoring
* Medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k) with match, paid time off, paid holidays, flexible spending account, life insurance and STD/LTD

**Location:** This position may work remotely anywhere in the United States of America with significant business travel to and from prospect/client sites and/or the Quantum Health home office in Dublin, OH.
**Who we are****:** We are a disruptive and pioneering force in the healthcare industry that has been revolutionizing patient and provider experiences for over 25 years. With a strong foundation built on innovation, customer intimacy, and profitability, we proudly serve over 3 million members by simplifying the complex healthcare landscape. Our human-centric, technology-driven approach has fueled our growth at an impressive rate of 20-30% annually for more than a decade. We are on a mission to evolve our core platforms, integrating comprehensive datasets to improve healthcare journeys with real-time insights into payer data, eligibility, plan designs, and more.
**About the role****:** The **Chief Technology Officer (CTO)** will lead our technology division and play a pivotal role in our ongoing success. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned, visionary leader passionate about leveraging technology to drive transformation in the healthcare sector. They will be instrumental in evolving our technology, ensuring it continues to integrate complex data sets effectively to enhance healthcare experiences. This role demands strategic acumen in managing relationships with private equity stakeholders and experience in leveraging a multi-faceted labor model to optimize technology delivery. This is an extraordinary opportunity to contribute to a company that blends the agility of a start-up with the stability of a profitable, customer-centric business.

* Drive the strategic direction of our technology initiatives, ensuring alignment with our overall business, financial and client goals.

* Deploy a variety of relevant labor models to ensure efficient, cost-effective technology development and support operations.
* Foster a culture of innovation, excellence, and collaboration within the technology team.

* Stay ahead of emerging technology trends and innovations, particularly those with the potential to impact the healthcare and call-center business models.

* Provide visionary leadership and mentorship to the technology team, nurturing a pipeline of talent and fostering a high-performing, inclusive work environment.

**What you’ll bring**
* Proven experience as a CTO or in a similar leadership role within the technology sector, preferably in healthcare or related industries.
* Demonstrated experience working with private equity stakeholders and understanding their unique requirements and perspectives for short and long term business priorities.
* Experience in multi-faceted development teams that includes on-site, remote, contract and off-shore resources, with a strong grasp of global talent management and operational efficiencies.

* Deep understanding of the healthcare industry's complexities, including payer data, eligibility, plan design, benefits, and provider interactions.
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to anticipate and navigate the challenges of a rapidly evolving industry.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, with a proven ability to inspire and mobilize teams towards a common goal.
* A commitment to continuous learning and staying abreast of the latest technology trends and innovations.
* Trustworthy and accountable behavior, capable of viewing and maintaining confidential information daily.


**Why join us?**
* Be part of a company that is making a real difference in the lives of millions of people every day.

description:
### **About Platform.sh**



The Platform.sh Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) removes the complexities of cloud infrastructure management and optimizes development-to-production workflows, reducing the time it takes to build and deploy applications. Delivering efficiency, reliability, and security, giving development teams both control and peace of mind. Built for developers, by developers.



Adopted and loved by 16,000+ developers, 7,000 customers, and proven over the last 8 years — Platform.sh provides out-of-the-box capabilities that serve as the launchpad for creative development teams’ out-of-the-box thinking.



We provide 24x7 support, managed cloud infrastructure, and automated security and compliance with an all-in-one PaaS. We give our customers complete control over their data by keeping applications secure and available around the clock.



Platformers are a remote, global workforce, and we thrive in a multicultural team. We are committed to open source and an open, welcoming environment. Our team spans the globe and the experience spectrum. What's our commonality, our cultural fabric? A curious spirit and a thirst for knowledge; an eagerness for innovative ideas and cultures. We believe we can build anything together in an environment that frees you to do your best work.



Bring your expertise and enthusiasm to our growing, global organization. Your contributions, collaboration, and unique point of view are recognized and valued here.


### **Position Summary**



Join us as the Chief Product Officer, a pivotal role guiding product innovation, market success, and customer satisfaction. This position marries technical prowess, business acumen, leadership finesse, and adept communication to steer globally dispersed, cross-functional teams in shaping our product strategy.



Within our collaborative trifecta of Product, Engineering, and Design, we nurture an ecosystem of evolution. Our complex product continually evolves, not only technically but also through substantial and frequent feature additions. As CPO, you'll orchestrate multiple interconnected products, fostering an entrepreneurial spirit to nurture each feature as a unique entity. Your task: ensure flawless integration, guaranteeing a seamless and unified user experience.



This role offers a perpetual stream of innovation within a diverse feature ecosystem. Join us for the thrill of crafting meaningful value in our ever-evolving product landscape.


### **What to expect**


* Strategic Product Planning, Leadership and Execution: Develop, implement and drive product strategy by leveraging market opportunities and data-driven insights. aligning vision with business values, anticipating market trends, and crafting a forward-looking product vision.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Coordinate departments for timely, high-quality product releases, ensuring alignment and collaboration among marketing, sales, customer success, and engineering teams.
* Product Development Oversight: Lead global product initiatives from concept to launch, fostering innovation and maintaining a dynamic product roadmap.
* User Experience: Create intuitive products ensuring seamless customer journeys for satisfaction and loyalty.
* Empowering Team Leadership: Cultivate a high-performing product team, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
* Effective Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with executives, investors, and board members, presenting product strategies, roadmaps, and performance metrics.
* Performance Measurement and Compliance Assurance: Establish KPIs and metrics to track product performance, customer satisfaction, and market success. Continuous data analysis will drive ongoing product enhancements, ensuring compliance with regulations and industry trends.
* Market Analysis and Competitive Intelligence: Conduct deep market research, leverage insights for product positioning, differentiation, and pricing strategies.

### **What you bring**


* An Engineering background and extensive knowledge of the ever-evolving PaaS market dynamics and adeptness in B2B technology product management, focusing on key performance indicators (KPIs) such as market penetration, customer retention, and revenue growth. A minimum of 5 years experience and proven success in our industry is required.
* Technical Proficiency: Your expertise in product development methodologies, cutting-edge technologies, and industry trends, along with mastery of agile, lean practices, UX/UI design, and profound technical understanding, is essential. Experience with developer tools such as Git, CI/CD, various web apps, frameworks, DevOps, cloud infrastructure, databases, and message queues is crucial.
* Business Acumen: Your robust business acumen plays a crucial role in harmonizing our product strategies with core business objectives. Proficiency in analyzing market data, conducting financial assessments, and comprehending market dynamics guides data-centric decisions.
* Leadership Excellence: Leading through inspiration, you'll set a compelling vision and nurture collaboration, fostering the full potential of team members. A proven track record of spearheading multiple, globally dispersed product teams and crafting robust, high-performing teams aligns seamlessly with our values.
* Stellar Communication: In our global setting, outstanding communication is paramount. Your ability to articulate intricate concepts, negotiate with stakeholders, and propagate the product vision, strategies, and performance metrics to internal and external stakeholders is key. Strong interpersonal skills further enrich our distinctive workplace environment.

  


### **This is a remote job. Work from anywhere.**



We’re a worldwide, distributed team looking for the best talent. Our remote model has been in practice and thriving since 2014. To us, remote work means flexibility and having truly diverse, global teams.


### **Company perks and benefits**


* An innovative product you can believe in. We’re sustainably changing the way companies develop and manage their web applications
* We’re voted as A Best Place to Work by 96% of our employees, Forbes Top 30 Companies for Remote Jobs, and in France Best Workplaces for Women
* Hands on leadership that cares in a flexible, open work environment, where your voice is encouraged. We can always find ways to do better and look forward to hearing your ideas
* A global team, rich with culture and diversity

* Inclusive parental leave (timeline based on location)
* Healthcare, dental, and vision (US, CA, UK, and FR employees only)
* Tandem – a pool of linguists from around the world willing to help each other work on learning new languages

We know that a great hire won’t meet every requirement that we’ve outlined. If you can see yourself elevating the team, we want to hear your story. Few of us would be here had we not taken a chance.

title: CTO (Chief Technology Officer)
description:
**Who We Are**


Murmuration is a nonprofit organization that amplifies the power of civic engagement by providing data, digital tools, and research-driven insights to community-focused organizations so that together we can create an America where everyone can lead healthy, free, and dignified lives.


Every day, people are trying to shape our future for the better. Fighting for water that’s safe to drink. Schools that serve students equitably. Gun laws that make sense. And rallying people who care like we do. And yet too often the skillful organizers working to mobilize communities lack access to technology that could supercharge their efforts. Knocking on every door instead of knowing which will open most easily. And going up against outside interests that have half the heart, but twice the tools.


In communities across America, Murmuration’s partners are leveraging our data, tools, and insights to help thousands of organizers orchestrate millions of individual people to do big things together. Demand big things together. To create the world they want. Together.

**About the Position**


Murmuration is looking for a technology leader to help drive the next phase of our growth. Over its first decade, Murmuration has developed a powerful toolset, extensive data and data science assets, and significant research findings all of which are delivered to our partners through a robust enterprise engagement platform we call Organizer. You will be the most senior technology voice in the organization and an essential piece of our Executive Leadership Team. Our CTO will be our technical guide and executive collaborator on how technology makes more impact possible through our Partners. You will develop and grow a large technology team, providing strong management, direction, and technical leadership. You believe in the power of people and teams to build incredible tools and are committed to a Partner-centric perspective on making progress and on guiding our technology roadmap. You will play an essential role on the executive team and ensure that the way we understand, embrace, develop, and deploy technology is deeply connected to our Theory of Change and consistent with our principles. We are both a sector-defining and defying impact organization and a world-class technology organization. Understanding and embracing both aspects of our identity, strategy, and culture are essential to our success and to making the kind of transformation we believe is possible and necessary in the world happen.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Provide overall organizational leadership and strategic direction in close collaboration with other colleagues on the Executive Leadership Team. Identify and leverage opportunities to integrate our work across teams and functions
* Thoughtfully coordinate our Technical Roadmap with our Product Roadmap, ensuring alignment with our overall strategic plan and Theory of Change
* Integrate our technical processes with our Partnerships and Support processes to ensure we put our Partners first AND learn everything we can from their experiences, to better inform our solutions
* Grow and lead a world-class technology team, providing empathetic leadership and strong team management, guidance, and direction to your team leaders
* Set up strong team structures, ensuring that functions and roles are streamlined to facilitate effective collaboration and support efficient processes
* Empower your Technology Teams with expert technical direction and clear decision-making, ensuring that our technical infrastructure is secure, performant, and flexible enough to develop and deploy new ideas quickly
* Assess new and emerging external technologies for opportunities to partner or integrate as new ideas rise through our teams
* Serve as a speaker and technical ambassador for the organization at strategic events with funders, partners, etc. throughout the year, as needed
* Create and track progress to goals and objectives for the Technology Division, in collaboration with the Executive Leadership Team
* Foster a cohesive and inspiring team culture, rooted in a strong commitment to collaboration, technical excellence, and continuous learning
* Coordinate with Operations and other teams to ensure we develop sound Licensing, Data, and Privacy policies and practices
* Oversee the Technology Division’s budget

Note: At Murmuration, we are committed to becoming an even more diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. To this end, all staff members are expected to actively participate in DEI (diversity, equity, inclusion) programming.

**Requirements**

**What You Should Have**

* Exceptional understanding of the relationship between how people use technology, how diverse organizations adopt technology, and how to build modern platforms that meet continually evolving partner needs
* Experience with high-throughput synthetic data and modeling services
* Experience developing and deploying both enterprise and consumer systems
* Demonstrated track record of on-time delivery and on-going interaction and development of complex platforms
* Excellent manager of people and teams
* Demonstrated vision for how technology relates to mission and how functions and role give people connection to mission
* Broad experience leading and managing product and engineering teams
* Broad fluency in service-based architectures, high-volume APIs, and platform integrations

**What You Could Have**

* Background in social impact, particularly with grassroots organizing and/or political campaigns
* Familiarity with other organizing and advocacy tools
* Experience with voter data

Experience with political modeling practices  
* 

Talented CTOs come from all walks of life and careers. If you are passionate about civic engagement and technology, please apply, even if you do not check every box!

**Benefits**

**Location and Compensation**


The Chief Technology Officer is a full-time, salaried position with a comprehensive benefits package (more detail below). It is based anywhere in the U.S. with some required travel. The starting salary range for this position is $230,000 - $330,000 and is commensurate with experience.

**Our Culture of Care**


We work hard to create a culture of care to ensure that our staff are best equipped to lead happy, healthy, and balanced lives. To that end, we offer a comprehensive benefits package which includes:

* Health, vision, and dental insurance with 100% of premiums covered for you and qualifying family members;
* Retirement benefits with a 5% employer match;
* A flexible unlimited PTO plan;
* Generous paid parental leave;
* Pre-tax commuter benefits;
* A company laptop;
* A flexible remote work environment;
* A home office setup stipend for all new employees;
* Monthly reimbursement for remote work expenses;
* A yearly professional development fund;
* Mental health and wellness benefits through Calm and Better Help; and
* Yearly in-person staff retreats; and
* A welcoming culture that celebrates diversity, equity, and inclusion.

**Our Guiding Principles**


These principles serve as the foundation for our internal culture.

*We succeed when our partners succeed.*


All of our work is intended for organizations that translate individual agency into collective action and power AND share our vision of a vibrant, healthy future America – even when we do not always agree on everything.

*We are stronger together.*


People do not pursue their potential alone. Communities do not solve their problems alone. Organizations do not thrive alone. And we do not work alone.

*We are always learning.*


We engage with the world, our partners, and our teammates with respect and curiosity – always listening first while carefully challenging our assumptions.

*We take a long view.*


Our vision for America is not a fixed endpoint but instead a product of ongoing, strategic, community-led collective action that strengthens the systems we depend on.

**An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to Diversity**


Murmuration is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as an organization committed to diversity and the perspective of all voices, we consider applicants equally of race, gender, color, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, disability, political affiliation and national origin. We reasonably accommodate staff members and/or applicants with disabilities, provided they are otherwise able to perform the essential functions of the job.

title: Chief Research & Technology Officer, DCRI
description:
School of Medicine Established in 1930, Duke University School of Medicine is the youngest of the nation's top medical schools. Ranked sixth among medical schools in the nation, the School takes pride in being an inclusive community of outstanding learners, investigators, clinicians, and staff where interdisciplinary collaboration is embraced and great ideas accelerate translation of fundamental scientific discoveries to improve human health locally and around the globe. Composed of more than 2,500 faculty physicians and researchers, more than 1,300 students, and more than 6,000 staff, the Duke University School of Medicine along with the Duke University School of Nursing, Duke University Health System and the Private Diagnostic Clinic (PDC) comprise Duke Health. a world-class academic medical center. The Health System encompasses Duke University Hospital, Duke Regional Hospital, Duke Raleigh Hospital, Duke Primary Care, Duke Home and Hospice, Duke Health and Wellness, and multiple affiliations.***Position Summary***


Dedicated to enhancing global health through innovative clinical research, the Duke Clinical Research Institute (DCRI) stands as an independent academic research institution associated with the Duke University School of Medicine (SOM). At the core of its mission is the conduct and coordination of clinical trials, research networks, and implementation science projects, both nationally and internationally. Emphasizing patient-centered clinical research, DCRI faculty collaborates with experienced operations teams to design and implement studies that improve health outcomes. To meet its mission, the DCRI continuously advances new research methods that it develops and applies turning data into knowledge across the entire spectrum of clinical research. Rooted in its commitment to developing and sharing knowledge, the DCRI strives to make a lasting impact on local to global health.

  

Position Summary: Taking a pivotal role in this mission, the Chief Research Technology Officer (CRTO) will have primary responsibility for envisioning, designing, delivering and managing the lifecycle of the research technology stack and portfolio for the Duke Clinical Research Institute (DCRI). This leader will build trusted relationships and active dialogue with DCRI operations, therapeutic areas, and all essential operational units within DCRI and with the broader technology leadership across Duke University.

  


The successful candidate will be an experienced IT professional with strong leadership and a demonstrated track record in establishing high-performing cultures and delivering complex IT solutions in a matrix organization. The CRTO will be a collaborative partner who can build trust and credibility with constituents across the DCRI, Duke University and work with partners to develop an inclusive and successful strategy to support the rapidly evolving research technology and IT needs for the DCRI. The CRTO will be a forward-thinking, innovative leader with knowledge of new trends in technology supporting research and the ability to lead change effectively in a growing and evolving matrixed organization and university.

  


\\*\\* NOTE: This position may have an opportunity to work remotely. All Duke University and Duke Health remote workers must reside in one of the following states or districts: Arizona; California; Florida; Georgia; Hawaii; Illinois; Maryland; Massachusetts; Montana; New Jersey; New York; North Carolina; Pennsylvania; South Carolina; Tennessee; Texas; Virginia or Washington, DC.

  


***Primary Responsibilities and Task***

Strategy & Innovation:


* Overall responsibility for developing and deploying strategic and operational plans and execution that transform technology delivery at DCRI. This includes technology innovation for advancing clinical research (e.g., positioning DCRI for early adoption of AI).
* Using a modern SDLC, clarifies and reinforces rigor and process in a lightweight and agile approach.
* Responsible for organizing work into a Plan-Build-Run execution model that establishes clear accountability and expectations for internal and external customers, stakeholders and sponsors.
* Provides strategic organizational leadership to enable coordination between central and distributed IT units including the identification of synergies with Duke University and Duke University Health System (DTHS).
* Establishes a robust and secure technology landscape that is considered a leader in technological capabilities to fully meet the needs of a large and rapidly growing research portfolio in the coming years.
* Provides strategic and operational leadership in advancing innovation and digital transformation initiatives across the University to further Duke’s impact on advances in biomedical research.
* Acts as a trusted advisor and partner within and outside of DCRI, including with the SOM and DHTS IT Leadership.
* Oversees the management of strategic technology partner and vendor relationships.
* Represents the organization externally on technology matters and comfortabley interfaces directly with key commercial customers and federal agencies on project related concerns and potential business development.
* Demonstrates commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working environment and culture.

  




Operations Leadership:


* Accountable for the successful delivery of a diverse technology and services portfolio that serves all of DCRI.
* Stays abreast with all applicable FDA, GCP, PHI and SEI regulations.
* Ensures compliance with all computer system validation, privacy and security related regulations including government and other standards such as FISMA and GDPR.
* Develops a sound and usable software development lifecycle management (SDDLC) methodology that clearly articulates the purpose, capabilities, deliverables and schedule for every effort undertaken.
* Overall accountable for disaster recovery, high availability and system data integrity.
* Develops a robust and collaborative resourcing model where DCRI employees take ownership of vision, architecture, capability, and communications, while fostering external partnerships for effective execution.
* Ensures appropriate resourcing and prioritization that aligns with the overall mission of DCRI Technology Solutions.
* Builds strong Esprit De Corps within own line management and across essential partnerships to enhance collaboration and team effectiveness.
* Responsible for building a performance-based culture that communicates early and often with all key stakeholders and partners.

  


Financial Management:


* In collaboration with the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and all other internal stakeholders, has overall accountability for managing the entire technology budget as well as the development of long-range technology financial planning.
* Builds a prospective component-based architecture for DCRI that will be delivered using an investment mix of at least 50% sponsor and program-derived funding that will be deliverable based upon key program milestone dates.

**WHO ARE YOU?**

Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!


**THE ROLE:**

The Chief Technology Officer of Venue Nation is a key leadership role. This role blends execution and vision – the CTO will partner with business leaders to develop the technology strategy for the various concerts businesses in North America, and then will actively oversee deployment and support of these various technologies. In particular, the role will oversee technology in North American amphitheaters, theaters and clubs; oversee Concert-focused internal business systems; The CTO will focus on execution largely in year one. Top priorities for year in year one are ongoing deployment Pax Point of Sale hardware & conversion to new food & beverage point of sale platform for the majority of Live Nation’s indoor venues across the U.S.; additionally, the CTO will focus on Year 1 deployment of a multi-venue, multi-year venue network refresh & upgrade strategy across US venues; As such, The CTO will need experience leading large-scale projects and processes, with a hands-on, proactive style, and will need to travel to different venues to ensure smooth & effective delivery.


Thereafter, s/he will then shift to more forward thinking strategies and solutions, serving as a catalyst for change, while continuing to oversee ongoing deployment and support. There is a desire to introduce new technologies that enhance the customer experience, and the business needs a technical thought leader for this process, who can also lead execution after setting the strategy. CTO will need to be able to work closely with non-technical business leaders, as the CTO will lead the interaction between this technology team and the various Venue businesses in North America. S/he will need to exhibit sound executive judgment and business savvy, helping executives who are not proficient in technology make sound decisions and trade-offs.


The CTO will need to have experience building teams. The CTO will oversee a +/- 45 person team. In addition, CTO will collaborate with technology teams in the Ticketmaster business unit and partner with third parties such as Cisco, Salesforce, etc.


**IDEAL EXPERIENCES:**

* Significant experience (15+ years) as a group-level or large divisional CIO/CTO with responsibility for overall IT strategy, software development, business applications, infrastructure, data communications, and voice solutions for a large, complex, fast paced, and dynamic company.
* Hands-on experience leading complex IT projects, supporting business executives and being a strong constructive member of senior management.
* Demonstrated entrepreneurial approach to business process, balancing control with flexibility, procedure with simplicity, and willingness to innovate and change while creating an environment of rigor and discipline.
* Depth of knowledge around IT standards, process, software, infrastructure and systems. Successful past accountability for applications/software development, infrastructure and support, including the management of successful systems development, implementation and integration projects.
* Experience leading technology in physical environments, where issues of network connectivity and physical interaction with technology systems (such as point-of-sale) are crucial, and experience integrating many different technology systems in a single environment

**Competencies:**

* Results Orientation. The candidate will demonstrate an ability to drive an IT organization to high levels of performance, as evidenced by a track record of consistent delivery and development of services and systems to support the business. He/she will set extremely high expectations of availability and reliability of systems/infrastructure, responsiveness and pace, and urgency in implementing technology solutions. He/she will tend to set hard metrics for performance and have excellent project management disciplines, coupled with a personal inclination to drill into details and take corrective action early and decisively. This individual will have the ability to directly manage complex projects as need, and possess a willingness and capability to dive into details as needed.
* Collaboration & Influencing. Live Nation is a relationship-centric culture. This leader will naturally build relationships and work well with others. While working with others, this executive will need to have the competence to be a fairly autonomous, self-directed leader. The successful candidate will actively engage the team to develop plans and resolve issues through collaborative problem solving. This individual actively seeks input in decision-making and engages colleagues to make joint decisions. He/she is someone who invests in building relationships with others and effectively uses the informal structure and culture of an organization to get things done.
* Strategic Orientation. The CTO will have a forward thinking perspective with a well-informed point of view on the changing role of information technology in supporting and enabling the business, and will define a roadmap to achieve the CEO's vision of Live Nation as a technology innovator in the concerts business. He/she will have a strong grasp of business fundamentals and create the bridge between technology strategy and business strategy. He/she will have the capacity to clearly communicate to non-technical audiences and the ability to translate complex technology issues into terms that inform decision makers.
* Team Leadership. The candidate will have excellent leadership skills, as evidenced by a track record of hiring, retaining, developing and motivating top-tier technical and operations talent; providing an inspiring translation of a business strategy into specific IT objectives; building strong relationships based on trust with peers; and, a track record of personal engagement with customers, partners and suppliers.

* **HEALTH:** Medical, Dental and Vision benefits for you and your family, including Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and Health Savings Accounts (HSAs)

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
**About McKesson Compile**


Established in 1833, McKesson is a Fortune 10 global leader in healthcare supply chain management solutions, retail pharmacy, healthcare technology, community oncology, and specialty care. We partner with life sciences companies, manufacturers, providers, pharmacies, governments, and other healthcare organizations to help provide the right medicines, medical products, and healthcare services to the right patients at the right time, safely and cost effectively. Our enterprise consists of the following businesses:

* Pharmaceutical Solutions and Services (PSaS)
* Medical Surgical Solutions (MMS)
* CoverMyMeds (CMM)
* McKesson International (Europe and Canada)


McKesson draws upon its rich and nearly 200-year history to serve as the central nervous system of healthcare, touching nearly 1/3 of all pharmaceuticals used each day in North America, leading as the 4th largest pharmacy chain, and serving as the #1 distributor in Oncology and key specialties. Most recently, McKesson has been awarded the honor and public health responsibility of serving as the centralized distributor of the COVID 19 vaccine(s) and all associated ancillary products and supplies.


McKesson Compile’s data is a comprehensive, fully linked system of record for the U.S. Healthcare market, with intelligence on 2M+ healthcare professionals (HCPs) and over 800K facilities. Compile’s data includes high capture medical and pharmacy claims, closed capture Medicare claims (100%), along with best-in-class provider affiliations and customer master. The linked data enables commercial teams to move beyond the traditional approaches that only rely on claims volumes. Our innovations include - Best-in-class provider affiliations - Fully linked data across claims, affiliations, customer master and more - Cleansed, normalized and analytics-ready patient-level data.


We deliver careers with purpose and potential. Our focus on better health starts with creating an inclusive environment with strong values where you can build a fulfilling career. You can count on us to provide you with resources and opportunities to grow and be your best, while contributing to our pursuit of improving lives.


What sets McKesson apart as an exceptional place is our people. Our employees understand that together, unified by our global i²care values, we fulfil our mission and uphold our reputation as a trusted partner to our customers and their patients. Our i²care values are foundational to all that we do, and who we are as a company.


 Integrity – We do what’s right


 Inclusion – We embrace and respect each other as we are


 Customer First – We succeed when our customers succeed


 Accountability – We take personal responsibility for our actions and our work


 Respect – We treat people with dignity and respect


 Excellence – We insist upon quality


Location: Bangalore , Hybrid


The CTO based in Bangalore and is the key leader responsible for driving technological innovation and maximizing the value of McKesson Compile’s data assets. The CTO will develop and execute the technology strategy, overseeing infrastructure and development processes. They are responsible for managing data assets by establishing data governance, ensuring security and privacy, and maintaining data quality. The CTO collaborates with product, sales and operation teams to develop high value data products and services. The CTO is responsible for fostering a culture of innovation, staying abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends. As the technical leader, the CTO provides guidance to engineering teams and manages technological risks related to data commercialization. The CTO's role is critical in driving the success of McKesson Compile through leveraging technology and data assets.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for creating and executing the technology strategy aligned with the company's overall business objectives in partnership with McKesson central IT department.
* This involves identifying technology trends, evaluating potential opportunities, and making strategic decisions on technology investments.
* Plays a key role in driving the development of data commercialization products and services.
* Responsible for ensuring the company has robust data management systems, data governance policies, and data analytics capabilities to derive insights and value from the data assets.
* Stay updated on emerging technologies and innovations relevant to the data commercialization industry.
* identifying and evaluating new technologies, tools, and techniques that can enhance the company's offerings, improve efficiency, and drive innovation.
* Provides technical leadership to the technology teams within the organization.
* Setting technical standards, ensuring adherence to best practices
* Promoting knowledge sharing and fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
* Collaborates with other departments, such as sales, marketing, and operations, to understand their technology needs and align them with the company's overall strategy.
* Establish partnerships with technology vendors, research institutions, or other organizations to leverage external expertise and resources.
* Ensure data security and compliance of McKesson Compile
* In partnership with McKesson IT department establish and maintain robust security measures, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations, and addressing any security or privacy concerns. 8.
* Responsible for building and developing a high-performing technology team.
* Hiring and retaining top talent, providing mentorship and guidance, fostering a culture of learning and growth, and ensuring an inclusive workforce.
* Collaborate with the executive team to develop and manage the technology budget.
* Ensure effective resource allocation balancing investment in new initiatives, maintenance of existing systems, and operational efficiency.
* Key liaison between the technology team and other stakeholders, such as McKesson Technology, executives, clients and partners in communicating the technology strategy, progress, and challenges to ensure alignment and manage expectations.
 **Requirements**

* 15+ years demonstrated experience in setting organizational technology strategies
* 10+ years building market leading products and/or engineering differentiated products
* Experience dealing with disparate/unstructured data preferably in healthcare.
* Experienced in identifying technology trends, evaluate opportunities, and make informed decisions on technology investments.
* Demonstrated ability to choose frameworks and in being an early adopter of market leading technology.
* Deep understanding of data management, analytics, and emerging technologies related to data commercialization.
* Well-versed in data processing, data integration, data warehousing, data governance, machine learning, and other relevant technologies preferably in health care.
* Ability to set a clear technology vision and technology strategy for the company.
* Ability to think strategically and align technology initiatives with the overall business goals.
* Strong leadership skills, including the ability to inspire and motivate teams, foster collaboration, and drive innovation.
* Demonstrated experience operating in a complex organization with a geographically dispersed team.
* Effective communicator who can convey complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
* Demonstrated ability to build relationships with stakeholders, including executives, clients, partners and influence decision-making processes.
* Prior experience in the data commercialization industry would be highly beneficial. As well as prior knowledge of health care related challenges, regulatory considerations, and best practices.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills. Ability to analyze complex technical and business problems, evaluate multiple options, and make informed decisions to drive the company's technology initiatives forward.
* Strong references from prior Sales & Product executives around partnership and ability to execute on technology that accelerates company business strategy.

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
ENTERPRISE ARCHITECT
Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. We’re shaped by all who join us and together we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. We do this through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science which allows us to grow and innovate our global portfolio of category-leading brands including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum.
We’re creating a culture that’s uniquely ours, combining passion, knowledge and expertise to build a strong and successful business. This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future.
We operate across global markets and deliver technology through centralised and distributed teams. As a new company formed from separating from GSK we’ve been able to deliver significant transformation into a cloud first organisation, but there is much still to do. Our technology teams span a number of areas:* CTO
* Digital Technology Information Security (DTIS)
* Quality and Supply Chain
* Corporate Finance
* Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) and Manufacturing ERP
* Commercial ERP (CERPS)
* Customer Sales and Marketing
* HR


ABOUT THE ROLE
The Enterprise Architecture function in the business is pivotal to the future success of the organisation. This role will report to the new Global Head of Architecture who in turn reports directly to the Chief Digital and Technology Officer who is part of the Haleon Executive Team. The team is made up of Enterprise and Solution Architects covering a wide range of disciplines that ensure the long-term technical strategy aligns with the business vision. The team is uniquely placed to provide the coherent, centralised thought-leadership across all the technology domains.
The role will complement existing skillsets in the team and will draw upon your experience gained in other enterprise scale organisations to understand the Haleon technology landscape and drive long-term transformation. This requires a broad range of multi-disciplinary skills spanning technology domains and business capabilities including:* Enterprise Architecture: Relate the business vision and strategy to short, medium and long-term technical capabilities and articulate the transition states, dependencies and anticipated outcomes to a range of technical and non-technical audiences in verbal and written form.
* Thought Leader: Position yourself as the authority within Haleon for your speciality and maintain your knowledge at the forefront of technology, leading transformation and articulating strategy throughout the business. Problem solving and driving value from technologies will be key to success in the role.
* Trusted Advisor: The ability to communicate at all levels is key, as is providing confidence to the business through experience, knowledge and track record of success. Display a passion for sharing and expanding knowledge, but also recognise where to involve other disciplines to deliver coherent enterprise-wide architectural outcomes. Be the focal point for domain, solution and technical architects to ensure outcomes are aligned with strategy.
* Governance: Understand business drivers, strategy, value, risk and dependencies in the creation of architecture, and ensure alignment with these processes to deliver consistent outcomes.
* Delivery: Product/Project Delivery will deliver against your enterprise architecture. Understand how these areas at Haleon will achieve the optimal set of products and services which meets the business strategy and requirements.
* Quality, Risk & Compliance: Accountable for ensuring the architecture within the domain is compliant with internal security and risk management policies and practices, as well as external regulatory and statutory requirements e.g. GxP and that Tech stability and continuity plans are considered as part of strategy.
* People Management: Work in collaboration with the broader team to drive and deliver business value to tight timelines. At times this may require matrix management of other architects to deliver the outcome.
* Adoption strategy & change management: in the role of change agent, support both the product teams and the business in agile approaches to solution development and adoption, building excitement, momentum, visible success stories and clear value-based versions of vision as roadmap plans come to life.


KEY COMPETANCIES* Enterprise architecture knowledge and demonstrable experience with EA Frameworks (e.g. TOGAF, Zachman, C4) able to document and articulate strategy to technical and non-technical audiences.
* Comprehension of business strategy and how this translates to technology strategy for a large, globally distributed enterprise.
* Deep specialist knowledge in their field but with broad understanding across multi-disciplinary technical domains.
* Knowledge of current and developing technologies and how they will influence architecture.
* Data analysis from data models, architecture policy frameworks and compliance and abstract this into technology strategy.
* Communication and collaboration to all levels of both technical and non-technical audiences in central and distributed teams.
* Ability to identify gaps and opportunities and pivot strategy where necessary to meet business need, opportunity or risk.
* Knowledge of regulatory environments e.g. SOx/GxP.
* Integrity to do the right thing for the business despite resistance to change.


Qualifications and Relevant Work Experience* Overall 15+ years of experience in IT with demonstrable experience of developing and delivering enterprise scale strategy.
* MS/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Design, or equivalent experience with weighting on experience and proven record of accomplishment expected.
* Experience of technology consultancy or systems integration resulting in the development of strategy
* Candidate would ideally have built an impressive career in an advanced, recognised, and innovative environment with a track record of driving technology decisions in major change and transformation programmes
* Experience in the Healthcare and/or CPG industry, a cloud / technology company or technology consultancy role preferred.
* Experience of working in agile environment architecting and designing solutions in DEVOPS ways of delivery
* Ability to work in close partnership with other IT functions such as Corporate Technology, IT security, operational technology, compliance, infrastructure and Managed Service Providers.
* Ability to partner closely with business stakeholders and adapt messaging according to the audience.
* Excellent written and effective communication skills and ability to communicate complicated technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

At Haleon we embrace our diverse, global workforce to create an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives and experience. We pride ourselves on the curiosity and camaraderie of our team and promote fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.

We are committed to reinvent business processes and productivity, build the intelligent cloud platform and create more personal computing. These three goals are interconnected; allowing us to attract, develop and retain the best talent to be more innovative in the products and services we develop, in the way we solve problems, and in the way, we serve the needs of an increasingly global and diverse customer and partner base.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

Participates and leads gathering of customer requirements and constraints.
Participates in project planning and contributes to risks, issues, assumptions and dependencies.
Communicates the business value of planned technology uses and deployments.

Supports drafting proposals and/or statement of work (SOW).

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
##### **Job Information**


At Khushi Baby (KB) we seek to motivate and monitor community health care at the last mile. We build and implement community-inspired digital health solutions to empower frontline health workers to deliver informed care for pregnant women, children, and other vulnerable groups.


Khushi Baby is the Nodal Technical Support Partner to the Government of Rajasthan’s Department of Medical, Health, and Family Welfare, responsible for designing, developing, and implementing the State’s integrated community health platform out of the Rajasthan State Data Center.


Collectively, Khushi Baby’s solutions have been used by over 70,000 community health workers in the last year, with independent modules for COVID-19 active surveillance and longitudinal reproductive, maternal, neonatal, and child health tracking. These solutions have been used to track the health of over 17 million beneficiaries, making Khushi Baby’s m-health platform for government-employed community health workers, the second largest in the world. Beyond Rajasthan, we also have current solutions deployed in Maharashtra and Haryana.


Our solutions have included a variety of novel technology implementations and integrations including Near Field Communication, facial biometrics, and AI/ML for fraud detection. These solutions have emerged from over 5 years of experience working closely with health workers in the field in 400 villages of Udaipur.


We are seeking a mature, motivated, mission-driven Chief Technology Officer to join our lean technology team to manage, sustain, and grow existing solutions and help us build out our forthcoming integrated community health platform to serve as a model innovation for the Central Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.


The CTO will work closely with the leadership team, policy/program team and growing technical team of 7 developers to ensure robust, compliant, and scalable digital health applications.


We are looking for passionate, self-starters and team players who want to make a positive footprint on the health of families from underserved communities by applying their deep knowledge of technology as a vehicle for impact.


##### **What we require:**


* A willingness to put our mission first and to go to the last mile to ensure your solution is creating impact
* 5-7 years of professional combined working experience developing Android and Backend applications
* Outstanding communication, interpersonal skill and the ability to share/collaborate with peers
* You’ve managed, mentored, and inspired a small team of engineers providing architectural guidance, code reviews, etc.
* Extensive knowledge of microservices, automated deployments, RESTful APIs, version management, optimization, caching, data security and testing frameworks
* Proficiency with JAVA, Kotlin, XML, Android SDK, PostGres, MySQL, Git, Firebase, Ruby on Rails, Python, Kubernetes, Apache Airflow, Apache Kafka
* Experience in data pipeline and big data analysis
* Knowledge of MVP, MVC, MVVM design patterns

##### **What we prefer:**


* Background in public health, ICT4D, and digital health standard frameworks
* Experience with building offline-online capable apps
* Experience with facial biometrics, Near Field Communication, edge analytics

##### **Responsibilities Include:**


* Project management of 10+ live Khushi Baby projects
* Documentation
* Code Reviews
* Talent development
* Technical recruitment
* R&D

##### **How to apply**


To apply for the post of Chief Technology Officer, please send your detailed CV with a writing sample to careers@khushibaby.org

  

Khushi Baby gives high priority to gender equality in its organizational structure and employment opportunities.
